referred_to_by.content: Thomas Butts [1757 - 1845], London, by descent to his son, Thomas Butts, Jr. (1799-1845); Thomas Butts, Jr. [died 1862], London (1845-1862); William Michael Rossetti [1829-1919], London (by 1863-?); William Bell Scott [1811-1890], consigned to sale at Sotheby's, London (by 1876-1892); (Sotheby's, London, July 14, 1892, no. 238, sold to Quaritch) (1892); (Quaritch, sold to E.H. van Ingen for Mrs. William Emerson) (1892-1893); Mrs. William Emerson, consigned to sale at Sotheby's, London (1893-1958); (Sotheby's London, May 19, 1958, no.12, bought by Agnew for Lady Melchett) (1958); Lady Melchett [1928-], sold at Christie's, London (1958-1971); (Christie's London, November 9, 1971, no. 71, bought by Piccadilly Gallery) (1971-?); (Piccadilly Gallery, London, sold to Galleria Galatea); (Galleria Galatea, Turin, sold to private collector, Milan); private collector, Milan (by 1981-?); (Ben Elwes Fine Art, London, sold to the Cleveland Museum of Art) (2016-17); The Cleveland Museum of Art, Cleveland, OH (2017-)
